metadata.title: Journal Pre-proof Comparative review of respiratory diseases caused by coronaviruses and influenza A viruses during epidemic season Comparative review of respiratory diseases caused by coronaviruses and influenza A viruses during epidemic season, Microbes and Infection, https:// Comparative review of respiratory diseases caused by coronaviruses and influenza A 3 viruses during epidemic season 4

abstract.text: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) continues to sweep the 28 world, causing infection of millions and death of hundreds of thousands. The respiratory 29 disease that it caused, COVID-19 (stands for coronavirus disease in 2019), has similar clinical 30 symptoms with other two CoV diseases, severe acute respiratory syndrome and Middle East 31 respiratory syndrome (SARS and MERS), of which causative viruses are SARS-CoV and 32 MERS-CoV, respectively. These three CoVs resulting diseases also share many clinical 33 symptoms with other respiratory diseases caused by influenza A viruses (IAVs). Since both 34 CoVs and IAVs are general pathogens responsible for seasonal cold, in the next few months, 35 during the changing of seasons, clinicians and public heath may have to distinguish 36 COVID-19 pneumonia from other kinds of viral pneumonia. This is a discussion and 37 comparison of the virus structures, transmission characteristics, clinical symptoms, diagnosis, 38 pathological changes, treatment and prevention of the two kinds of viruses, CoVs and IAVs. It
39 hopes to provide information for practitioners in the medical field during the epidemic season.

body_text.text: In December 2019, a novel coronavirus, SARS-CoV-2, caused a pneumonia epidemic 44 in Wuhan, Hubei province of China. It erupted in many other countries in the following 45 months and eventually became a worldwide pandemic. The pneumonia was officially named 46 COVID-19 by World Health Organization (WHO) [1] . So far, the pandemic is still accelerating. More than 3.7 million people were confirmed infected, 260,000 more people However, the fact is that the 1918 H1N1 virus also caused more deaths in younger people 139 [38]. H7N9 and H5N1 viruses were limited in transmission due to the similar reason 140 mentioned above with MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV. However, the mortality of H7N9 is as 141 high as 37%, and H5N1 is 53% [39, 40] . Nevertheless, the high pathogenicity and high 142 mortality make them easier to be identified and controlled at the beginning of the break. 143 Although H7N9 and H5N1 viruses transmitted in humans ineffectively, their geographic 144 expansion and genetic recombination still suggested the potential of forming the next 145 pandemic [41, 42] . 146 As listed in Table 1 , people are easily infected with CoVs or IAVs through direct 147 contact and airborne droplets [43] . Since most of these viruses are of animal origin or use 148 animals as intermediate hosts [29, 31] , it is necessary to keep a safe distance between humans 149 and wild animals, as well as maintaining ecological balance in the world to prevent the 150 breaking of epidemics in future. 152 The major clinical symptoms are summarized in Table 2 Both CoVs and IAVs can cause ARDS and lead to multiple organ failure and death.

The published pathological data that were collected from autopsy, lung biopsies and chest 177 computed tomography (CT) scan are summarized in Table 3 . For patients with HPHTs 344 The authors declare that they have no conflicts of interest.

BIBREF113.title: Table 3. The pathological changes of the patients after infection

FIGREF1.text: . With the overview of the 8 153 viruses, the average incubation periods of the three HPCoVs are about 5 days or more, which 154 are a little longer than other viruses. At the early stage of disease onset, the cases with the 155 infection of different viruses mostly developed the same clinical symptoms --cough and 156 fever. However other clinical symptoms were various, such as myalgia which was common in damage, acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS), lactate dehydrogenase, and 163 lymphocytopenia. In addition, three HPCoVs and H7N9 IAV infection usually showed ground 164 glass pneumonia. MERS-CoV, SARS-CoV, H7N9 IAV, and H5N1 IAV caused more hepatic 165 injury. SARS-CoV-2 and H5N1 IAV meanwhile caused more heart failure. The critical patient 166 ratio of the HPHTs infection can be 10% to 70% after 2 to 10 days of the disease 167 development. 168 To detect the causative viruses, similar measures were applied for CoVs and IAVs. The 169 specimen can be swabs, blood, or trachea extracts. Then the viral RNAs can be directly 170 identified by reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) based methods, and 171 the virus specific antibodies can be detected with enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay 172 (ELISA) or related serological methods. More detailed information has been summarized in 173 the previous publication [13].

FIGREF3.text: 178 infection, the general manifestations of the lung pathological change were inflammatory 179 exudation or acute diffuse alveolar damage (DAD), with hyaline membrane formation, fibrin 180 mucoid exudation, interstitial and alveolar edema, inflammatory interstitial infiltration and 181 vascular congestion, epithelial cell proliferation, and pulmonary consolidation. However, 182 there is no fibrin exudate found in the lungs of MERS patients, which may be related to the 183 different stage of the disease progression. Almost all of the virus infections caused 184 bronchioles injury except COVID-19 and H7N9 IAV [85, 86], presented as the aggregation of 185 fibrin in the bronchial intracavitary, the loss of cilia, the exfoliation of bronchioles epithelium, 186 etc. It was reported that HCoVs were found to be associated with bronchiolitis in 187 immunocompromised people, the elderly and young children, but showed light disease in the 188 lungs.

FIGREF4.text: virus inhibitors were designed to target the different steps of virus replication 191 cycle. Some of them inhibit virus entry or release, some interfere gene synthesis, and some 192 inhibit virus protease, or some modulate innate immune response, like interferons etc. 193 However, there are no specific drugs for treatment of CoVs infection. Most often used for 194 treatment of SARS and MERS are ribavirin and lopinavir/ritonavir. Ribavirin is similar to 195 guanosine and inosine and interfere viral RNA replication, which is more frequently used in 196 combination with interferons to treat chronic hepatitis C infection [108]. Lopinavir and 197 ritonavir are two protease inhibitors previously approved for HIV treatment, which usually 198 used together and ritonavir as CYP3A4 inhibitor to enhance the activity of lopinavir [109]. 199 The suitable medications for COVID-19 are still under search. So far, one of the most 200 promising drugs is remdesivir (GS-5734), produced by Gilead Science, a nucleoside analog 201 that mimics adenosine for previously treatment of the Ebola virus infection [110]. Health 202 authorities in China have initiated clinical trials at multiple places in Hubei province to 203 evaluate the safety and efficacy of remdesivir on patients. However, under the pandemic 204 emergencies, the patients who recovered from critical situation usually took multiple 205 medications rather than remdesivir, which made assessment of the data from clinical trials 206 somewhat complicated [111] . Besides of China, Gilead Science started phase III trial. 207 National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) in the US are conducting phase 208 II trial. The French National Institute of Health and Medical Research (INSERM) also 209 evaluated the effect of remdesivir and other treatment on COVID-19 patients [112]. 210 Another promising drug is chloroquine or its analog, hydroxychloroquine. It was reported 211 that these two drugs may inhibit viral entry by affecting PH dependent endocytosis, and they 212 may also affect viral glycosylation by inhibiting glycosyl-transferases [113]. They were 213 approved to treat or prevent malaria, as well as rheumatoid arthritis, or systemic lupus 214 erythematosus etc. Moreover, hydroxychloroquine showed fewer side effects than 215 chloroquine [114]. Several clinical studies on hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine provided 216 fairly satisfying results, better trial designing would be needed to further confirm the 217 therapeutic effectiveness [115]. Besides of these medications, lopinavir/ritonavir, interferons, 218 as well as the Chinese medicine formulate were also recommended by China for treatment of 219 COVID-19 [116] .

FIGREF5.text: Currently, for clinical treatment of influenza infection, there are only three classes of 221 FDA (Food and Drug Administration)-approved antiviral drugs available, including M2 ion 222 channel inhibitors (amantadine and rimantadine), neuraminidase inhibitors (oseltamivir, 223 zanamivir, peramivir and laninamivir), and the most recently RNA polymerase inhibitors 224 (balxavirmarboxil) [117]. 225 Amantadine and rimantadine can prevent the virus from shelling in the cytoplasm, thus 226 inhibiting the transmission of virus offspring [118]. Although developed for many years, it 227 has been reported frequently that they are ineffective in clinical treatment due to drug 228 resistance of almost all currently circulating IAVs [119]. Furthermore, they have a relatively 229 large side effect on the human central nervous system, thus are no longer recommended by 230 WHO as the first choice of anti-influenza drugs for the treatment or prophylaxis of influenza 231 [118]. 232 Until now, the neuraminidase inhibitors (NAIs) are still the most ideal reagents for 233 clinical treatment [120]. NAIs can prevent the hydrolytic activity of neuraminidase when the 234 mature virus leaves the cell after budding, therefore stopping the virus from infecting healthy 235 cells [121]. However, with heavy use in clinic, widespread oseltamivir-resistant H1N1 H275Y 236 mutants have been identified [122]. According to a study carried out between 2008 and 2012 237 by WHO, oseltamivir resistance was found to be 2.9% (16/656 patients) [123], raising the 238 alert that whether we can deal with influenza viruses once they break through the last line of 239 defense? It has been found that probenecid can prevent the renal secretion of the parent 240 compound of oseltamivir and significantly increase the blood concentration of oseltamivir 241 [124]. Therefore the combination of oseltamivir and probenecid may be an important 242 treatment option for severe patients.

FIGREF6.text: 243Balxavir marboxil, with a brand name of Xofloza, can target to viral polymerase acidic244 protein (PA), block its endonuclease function, leading to the inhibition of virus mRNA 245 transcription and effectively prevent influenza A virus infection [125-127]. The antiviral 246 spectrum of Xofloza includes seasonal influenza strains and influenza strains resistant to 247 oseltamivir, significantly reducing the viral load compared with oseltamivir [128]. T-705 is a 248 new type of RNA polymerase inhibitor which can inhibit a wide range of viruses by directly 249 entering into the viral RNA chain or by binding directly to the viral RNA polymerase domain 250 to block viral RNA chain replication and transcription [129, 130]. It has been approved for 251 listing in Japan [131, 132]. 252 With this in mind, it is quite urgent to develop novel anti-influenza drugs with higher 253 antiviral potency and resistance barrier. Hemagglutinin glycoprotein, located on the surface of 254 influenza virions [133], plays a critical role in virus attachment and membrane fusion.

FIGREF7.text: 255Accompanied with HA structure characteristics elucidated, HA inhibitors appear to be one of256 13 the most promising candidates [134-137]. With high efficacy and broad antiviral activity, 257 some inhibitors targeting HA such as DAS181 and arbidol are currently in clinical 258 development stage or partly approved for influenza virus infection [138-140]. Considering the 259 antigen drift and shift of IAVs, the conserved regions on HA, such as the HA1 receptor 260 binding sites (RBS) and the HA2 stem domain, are more attractive for new drug design 261 [141-143]. A number of broad-spectrum neutralizing antibodies targeting above the two 262 domains have been identified. For example, CR9114 exerts a broader antiviral effect against 263 both influenza A and B viruses in mice by binding to HA stem domain, which may be useful 264 for the treatment of severe influenza disease [144].

FIGREF8.text: are many types of vaccines that have been used or are under investigation for 267 human viral disease, such as live attenuated virus vaccine, inactivated whole virus vaccine, 268 subunit or recombinant vaccine, DNA plasmids based vaccine, and mRNA based vaccine. 269 However, there are no available vaccines for prevention of CoV infection. More than 10 years 270 of research on the development of vaccines against MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV indicated 271 that S protein has the ability to induce neutralizing antibodies to stop virus infection [145, 272 146], which shines light on SARS-CoV-2 vaccine study.

FIGREF9.text: development of SARS-CoV-2 vaccine, an intense global effort is currently underway 274 [147]. So far several vaccines candidates have moved into clinical trials in China. One of 275 them moved into phase II trail on April 12, which was produced by the Institute of 276 Bioengineering, Academy of Military Medicine (NCT04341389) [148]. The research team led 277 by Professor Chen took the modified replication defective adenovirus as the vector, carried 278 the S gene of the new CoV, to stimulate immune memory of S protein in humans. Their phase 279 medical observation without showing side effects (NCT04313127). In addition, 281 LV-SMENP-DC, a dendritic cells vaccine, transduced with a lentivirus vector expression of 282 several minigenes of SARS-CoV-2 and immunomodulatory genes, was developed by 283 Shenzhen Geno-Immune Medical Institute (SGIMI) in China and used for injection of people 284 along with activated virus antigen-specific cytotoxic T cells (NCT04276896). SGIMI also 285 developed a second one using artificial antigen presenting cells (aAPCs) modified with 286 lentivirus vector carrying similar genes with LV-SMENP-DC (NCT04299724). Two 287 inactivated vaccines were approved for clinical trial as well, developed by the China National 288 Pharmaceutical Group (Sinopharm) and Sinovac Research and Development Co., Ltd 289 (NCT04352608) [147, 149-152]. 290 In addition to COVID-19 vaccine clinical trials in China, there are many SARS-CoV-2 291 vaccine clinical trials underway worldwide [153], such as a mRNA vaccine, mRNA-1273, 292 produced by Moderna, Inc. in US (NCT04283461); a DNA vaccine, INO-4800 by Inovio, Inc. 293 in US (NCT04336410); Bifidobacterium probiotic carrying S protein gene by Symvivo in 294 Canada (NCT04334980); adenovirus vaccine vector carrying S protein in UK 295 (NCT04324606), etc. Whereas SARS-CoV-2 only started emerging in the human population, 296 S protein, a major direct receptor interaction protein, and other viral proteins may continue 297 modifying themselves to better adapt to humans [154]. Gene modification will bring more 298 challenges into vaccine designing and development, especially the mutation in S protein 299 which has been picked up by most of the vaccines candidates mentioned above.

FIGREF10.text: Since the first H1N1 IAV vaccine was generated for prevention of the Spanish flu in301 1938 by Jonas Salk and Thomas Francis [155, 156], influenza vaccines have been improved 302 dramatically. There are many types vaccines approved in US with trade names such as 303 FluLaval, Fluarix, Agriflu, and Flublok. A live attenuated vaccine with the name of FluMist 304 was approved by the Food and Drug Administration in US in 2003, and which is delivered 305 through nasal spray [157]. To decrease side effects, animal and insect cells were also 306 approved to replace chicken embryos for growth of vaccine strain [158]. To provide 307 protection from most seasonal virus attacks using one shot, multiple dominant viruses were 308 included into one vaccine, such as those containing 3 or 4 different circulating strains and 309 called trivalent or quadrivalent vaccines [158, 159] . Before a universal vaccine was 310 successfully developed, it is necessary to switch vaccines strains year by year as the prevalent 311 influenza viruses mutate their genes or change their subtypes very frequently to escape from 312 the immune recognition [24, 29]. 313 Up to now, available commercial vaccines against the IAVs those listed in this article are 314 H1N1, H5N1 and H3N2 IAV vaccines, but not H7N9 flu vaccine. For example, a trivalent 315 inactivated vaccine, TIV, produced by Seqirus Inc., usually has H1N1, H3N2 and B subtype 316 viruses. FluMist, produced by Medimmune, Inc, is also used for H1N1 flu vaccine [158]. For 317 H5N1 IAV, several inactivated vaccines are approved for human use, such as Audenz 318 produced by Seqirus Inc [158], Prepandrix produced by GlaxoSmithKline Biologicals S.A 319 [160]. H3N2 virus is usually a seasonal flu subtype in the last 30 years, of which the vaccine 320 has been recommended for injection according to flu surveillance [29].

FIGREF11.text: and IAVs share many characteristics, especially in HPHTs. Most of them 323 infect the respiratory tract through direct contact and airway droplets and cause similar 324 clinical symptoms like fever, cough, and sore throat. In contrast, MERS-CoV, H7N9 and 325 H5N1 viruses rarely transmit between humans. SARS-CoV, H1N1pdm09, and H5N1 viruses 326 easily infect younger people. Severe patients usually infected with HPHTs develop bilateral 327 pneumonia, ARDS, respiratory failure, and even death. CT and autopsy showed that the main pulmonary pathological manifestations were DAD, hyaline membrane formation, alveolar and 329 interstitial edema, fibromyxoid exudation, etc. At present, there are no specific and effective 330 drugs or vaccines for the treatment and prevention of CoVs. However, thanks to clinicians' 331 and scientists' efforts worldwide, some promising progress has been made in the treatment of 332 the diseases. Although there are some drugs and vaccines for the treatment and prevention of 333 IAVs, it is still necessary to further research and develop more effective methods of treatment 334 and prevention to better control the influenza epidemic.
